snippet: The blaze tore through the six floors of an apartment building on West 136th Street near Amsterdam Avenue; the cause was under investigation but was considered suspicious, an official said.
abstract: Fire tears through six-floor apartment building in Hamilton Heights neighborhood of Manhattan, killing one person and injuring dozen others; cause of blaze is under investigation but is considered suspicious because of its size.

byline.original: By EMMA G. FITZSIMMONS and KATE PASTOR

lead_paragraph: The blaze tore through the six floors of an apartment building on West 136th Street near Amsterdam Avenue; the cause was under investigation but was considered suspicious, an official said.

headline.main: A Fire in Manhattan Kills One and Injures 12
headline.print_headline: A Fire in Manhattan Kills One and Injures 12
